# Professional UI Design Principles

Reference document for `opus_ui_design` agent. Based on research from lovable.dev, aurora.build, and modern design systems.

## The "AI Look" Problem

Most AI-generated UIs are instantly recognizable because they share common patterns:
- Excessive gradients (especially purple-to-blue)
- Purple as the primary color
- Over-rounded corners on everything
- Too many competing colors
- Harsh shadows
- Generic placeholder text
- Cookie-cutter templates

**Our goal**: Create UIs that look like they were designed by a senior designer, not generated by AI.

## Design Principles

### 1. Intentional Restraint

Every visual element should earn its place. Ask:
- Does this color serve a purpose?
- Does this shadow add depth or just noise?
- Is this animation functional or decorative?

**Rule**: When in doubt, remove it.

### 2. Color Discipline

```
PROFESSIONAL PALETTE STRUCTURE
================================================================================

PRIMARY (1 color)
├── Used for: CTAs, important actions, links
├── Coverage: ~5-10% of UI
└── Example: Near-black or brand color

NEUTRALS (core palette)
├── Used for: 90% of the UI
├── Range: White to near-black with 5-7 shades
└── Example: Slate, Gray, Stone (not pure black/white)

ACCENT (0-2 colors)
├── Used for: States, feedback, highlights
├── Coverage: <5% of UI
└── Example: Blue for info, Green for success

SEMANTIC (fixed meanings)
├── Success: Green tones
├── Warning: Amber/Orange tones
├── Error: Red tones
└── Info: Blue tones
================================================================================
```

### 3. Typography Hierarchy

Clear hierarchy guides users through content:

```
================================================================================
HEADING LEVELS (mobile / desktop)
================================================================================
H1 (Hero)      : 32px / 48-64px, font-bold, tracking-tight
H2 (Section)   : 24px / 36px, font-semibold
H3 (Card Title): 20px / 24px, font-semibold
H4 (Subsection): 18px / 20px, font-medium

BODY TEXT
Large  : 18px, text-muted-foreground (for intros)
Regular: 16px, text-foreground (default)
Small  : 14px, text-muted-foreground (secondary)
Caption: 12px, text-muted-foreground (metadata)
================================================================================
```

### 4. Spacing System

Consistent spacing creates rhythm:

```
================================================================================
SPACING SCALE (Tailwind)
================================================================================
Micro    : 4px  (space-1) - icon gaps, tight inline
Small    : 8px  (space-2) - button padding, list items
Medium   : 16px (space-4) - component padding
Large    : 24px (space-6) - card padding, section content
XLarge   : 32px (space-8) - between major elements
XXLarge  : 48px (space-12) - between sections
Hero     : 64px (space-16) - hero sections, page separators
================================================================================

COMMON PATTERNS
Component padding    : p-4 to p-6
Card internal spacing: space-y-4
Section spacing      : py-16 md:py-24
Container max-width  : max-w-7xl (1280px)
Content max-width    : max-w-2xl (672px) for text
================================================================================
```

### 5. Visual Depth

Use subtle depth to create hierarchy:

```
================================================================================
SHADOW SCALE
================================================================================
None     : For flat elements, inline content
Soft     : shadow-sm - cards, dropdowns
Medium   : shadow-md - hover states, modals
Elevated : shadow-lg - popovers, floating elements

BACKDROP
Blurred overlays   : backdrop-blur-sm
Modal backgrounds  : bg-background/80 backdrop-blur
================================================================================
```

## Color Palettes (Recommended)

### Neutral-First (Most Professional)

```css
/* Slate-based neutrals */
--background: oklch(1 0 0);           /* White */
--foreground: oklch(0.145 0 0);       /* Near-black */
--muted: oklch(0.97 0 0);             /* Light gray */
--muted-foreground: oklch(0.556 0 0); /* Medium gray */
--border: oklch(0.922 0 0);           /* Border gray */
--primary: oklch(0.205 0 0);          /* Dark for authority */
```

### Warm Neutrals (Approachable)

```css
/* Stone-based neutrals */
--background: oklch(1 0 0);
--foreground: oklch(0.147 0.004 49.25);
--muted: oklch(0.97 0.001 106.424);
--muted-foreground: oklch(0.553 0.013 58.071);
--border: oklch(0.923 0.003 48.717);
--primary: oklch(0.216 0.006 56.043);
```

### Blue Accent (Trust/Professional)

```css
/* Blue accent for CTAs and links */
--primary: oklch(0.546 0.245 262.881);
--primary-foreground: oklch(0.985 0 0);
/* Use sparingly - 5-10% of UI */
```

## Component Design Guidelines

### Cards

```jsx
// ✅ Professional card
<div className="rounded-lg border bg-card p-6 shadow-sm">
  <h3 className="font-semibold">{title}</h3>
  <p className="mt-2 text-sm text-muted-foreground">{description}</p>
</div>

// ❌ AI-looking card
<div className="rounded-3xl bg-gradient-to-br from-purple-500 to-pink-500 p-4 shadow-2xl">
```

### Buttons

```jsx
// ✅ Clear hierarchy
<Button>Primary Action</Button>              // Filled, high contrast
<Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button> // Subtle fill
<Button variant="outline">Tertiary</Button>   // Border only
<Button variant="ghost">Minimal</Button>      // No border, subtle hover

// ❌ Too many prominent buttons
<Button className="bg-gradient-to-r from-blue-600 to-purple-600">
```

### Forms

```jsx
// ✅ Clean forms
<div className="space-y-6">
  <div className="space-y-2">
    <Label>Email</Label>
    <Input placeholder="you@example.com" />
  </div>
  <Button type="submit">Submit</Button>
</div>

// ❌ Cluttered forms
<div>
  <Label className="text-purple-500 font-bold">EMAIL *</Label>
  <Input className="border-2 border-purple-400 rounded-2xl" />
</div>
```

## Section Patterns

### Hero Section

```jsx
<section className="py-24 md:py-32">
  <div className="container mx-auto px-4">
    <div className="max-w-3xl">
      <h1 className="text-4xl font-bold tracking-tight sm:text-5xl md:text-6xl">
        Your headline here
      </h1>
      <p className="mt-6 text-xl text-muted-foreground">
        Supporting text that explains the value proposition.
      </p>
      <div className="mt-10 flex flex-col sm:flex-row gap-4">
        <Button size="lg">Primary CTA</Button>
        <Button size="lg" variant="outline">Secondary CTA</Button>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</section>
```

### Feature Grid

```jsx
<section className="py-16 md:py-24 bg-muted/50">
  <div className="container mx-auto px-4">
    <div className="text-center mb-12">
      <h2 className="text-3xl font-bold tracking-tight">Section Title</h2>
      <p className="mt-4 text-muted-foreground max-w-2xl mx-auto">
        Brief description of what this section contains.
      </p>
    </div>
    <div className="grid sm:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3 gap-8">
      {/* Feature cards */}
    </div>
  </div>
</section>
```

## Anti-Patterns to Avoid

### ❌ Gradient Abuse

```css
/* NEVER use unless explicitly requested */
bg-gradient-to-r from-purple-500 to-pink-500
bg-gradient-to-br from-blue-600 via-purple-600 to-pink-600
```

### ❌ Purple Dominance

```css
/* Purple is the AI cliché color - avoid as primary */
text-purple-500
bg-purple-600
border-purple-400
ring-purple-500
```

### ❌ Over-Rounding

```css
/* Excessive rounding looks unprofessional */
rounded-3xl
rounded-full (on large elements)
```

### ❌ Shadow Abuse

```css
/* Too much shadow looks cheap */
shadow-2xl
shadow-[0_20px_50px_rgba(0,0,0,0.3)]
```

### ❌ Animation Overload

```css
/* Keep animations minimal and functional */
animate-bounce
animate-pulse (except for loading)
animate-spin (except for loading)
```

## Checklist Before Shipping

- [ ] No gradients (unless justified and approved)
- [ ] No purple as primary/dominant color
- [ ] Limited to 2-3 colors total
- [ ] Sufficient whitespace
- [ ] Clear typography hierarchy
- [ ] Consistent spacing
- [ ] Works in both light and dark mode
- [ ] Passes accessibility contrast checks
- [ ] Mobile responsive
- [ ] No excessive animations
